paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information related to the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: Median age 69 years, predominantly male, white or black/African American

individual_records.evidence_sentence: A greater proportion of those who died were ≥ 75 years and showed clinical evidence of more advanced HF compared with those who were alive throughout treatment.
Most deaths in both treatment arms were adjudicated as cardiovascular due to heart failure (HF), consistent with the natural history of the disease.

functional_data.summary: The TTR protein is involved in the transport of thyroxine and retinol-binding protein.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families with a history of hATTR amyloidosis.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on clinical presentation and family history.
variants.additional_notes: The study observed a mortality imbalance between treatment arms.
key_quotes: Transthyretin-mediated amyloidosis (ATTR amyloidosis) is a rapidly progressing, life-threatening disease caused by misfolded transthyretin (TTR) protein.
Death usually occurs from progressive HF.

extraction_metadata.notes: Extracted data was comprehensive and aligned with the requirements.
